page.title: 04QUARLES FARM - EGMERE AREA
page.content: {Quarles Farm}has 700 acres of mainly sandy loam. It is worked by one manager and five full-time employees. {Crops:}135 acres of{sugar beet}yield- ing about 18 tons per acre, 70 acres of{milling wheat}(in beet rotation) yielding over 3 tons an acre, 400 acres of{barley}for milling of which half is sown in Autumn and half in Spring (after sugar beet). 50 acres are grown for seed. Yield is about 2\ tons an acre. 40 acres are let each year for{carrots.}55 acres of long term leys are maintained to support a herd of 40 pedigree{Sussex cows, producing registered breeding stock. In winter the cattle are fed on by-products of arable crops: barley straw, sugar beet tops. Some fodder beet is grown also as feed. A large range of machinery is kept and main- tained. Emphasis on quality crops.
